title: Associate Director, Advanced Analytics
description:
Please note that we will never request payment or bank account information at any stage of the recruitment process. As we continue to grow our teams, we urge you to be cautious of fraudulent job postings or recruitment activities that misuse our company name and information. Please protect your personal information during any recruitment process. While Monks may contact potential candidates via LinkedIn, all applications must be submitted through our official website (monks.com/careers).Job Description: Associate Director of Analytics at .Monks
Position OverviewThe Associate Director of Analytics at .Monks will oversee data strategy, measurement frameworks, and performance analysis to drive actionable insights for clients and internal stakeholders. This role requires leadership in developing scalable analytics solutions, guiding teams in advanced data techniques, and ensuring seamless integration of analytics into broader marketing, creative, and business strategies. As a thought leader, the Associate Director will foster innovation in analytics practices while maintaining alignment with client goals.
Key Responsibilities


Analytics Strategy & Leadership:

Develop and implement comprehensive analytics frameworks aligned with client business objectives.
Drive the evolution of data-driven decision-making across digital campaigns and platforms.
Collaborate with senior leadership to set measurable KPIs and define success metrics.



Data Management & Insights:

Oversee data collection, processing, and visualization to ensure accuracy and relevance.
Conduct advanced analytics, including attribution modeling, predictive analysis, and ROI measurement.
Translate data findings into actionable insights to optimize marketing and creative efforts.



Team Collaboration & Mentorship:

Lead a team of analysts, ensuring professional development and fostering a collaborative work environment.
Partner with cross-functional teams, including creative, strategy, and technology, to integrate analytics into projects.



Client Engagement:

Serve as a key client-facing expert, presenting insights, reports, and strategic recommendations.
Manage client relationships, ensuring analytics solutions exceed expectations and drive measurable impact.



Technology & Innovation:

Stay informed on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in analytics and martech.
Champion the adoption of innovative solutions to enhance analytics capabilities.



Qualifications

Proven experience (7+ years) in analytics, data strategy, or a related field, preferably in an agency or consultancy environment.
Strong expertise in digital marketing analytics, web analytics (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics), and advanced tools like Tableau or Power BI.
Proficiency in statistical analysis, SQL, Python, or R is highly desirable.
Demonstrated success in leading teams and managing complex, multi-faceted analytics projects.
Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with a talent for simplifying complex data narratives for diverse audiences.
Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Marketing, Data Science, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.

Preferred Skills

Familiarity with marketing platforms like Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and programmatic platforms.
Experience with experimentation frameworks, such as A/B testing and multivariate testing.
Knowledge of data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and their impact on analytics strategies.

Why Join .Monks?As a part of .Monks, you'll work at the intersection of creativity and data, collaborating with world-class teams to deliver groundbreaking solutions for global brands. This role offers the opportunity to shape the future of analytics in a fast-paced, innovative environment.
#LI-REMOTE
#LI-ZZ1What We Offer
Benefits

Excellent, full coverage medical, dental, and vision insurance with employer-paid HRA
Generous PTO and 15 company-wide holidays
401k with company contribution
Paid parental leave
Work-life balance with an emphasis on personal well-being
Career growth in a disruptor space & entrepreneurial opportunities within the Monks network¬†
A globally diverse & inclusive culture with employee resource groups such as S4 Melanin, Pride.Monks, Cultura.Monks, and more!
Authentic commitment to DEI efforts and sustainable growth. (Why Sir Martin Sorrell signed The Climate Pledge here!)

¬†
¬†
Monks has provided a compensation range that represents its good faith estimate of what Monks may pay for the position at the time of posting. Monks may ultimately pay more or less than the posted compensation range. The salary offered to the selected candidate will be determined based on job-related factors, but not based on a candidate‚Äôs sex or any other protected status.
¬†Salary Range$120,000‚Äî$170,000 USDAbout Monks
Monks is the global, purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc. With a legacy of innovation and specialized expertise, Monks combines an extraordinary range of global marketing and technology services to accelerate business possibilities and redefine how brands and businesses interact with the world. Its integration of systems and workflows delivers unfettered content production, scaled experiences, enterprise-grade technology and data science fueled by AI‚Äîmanaged by the industry‚Äôs best and most diverse digital talent‚Äîto help the world‚Äôs trailblazing companies outmaneuver and outpace their competition.
Monks was named a Contender in The Forrester Wave‚Ñ¢: Global Marketing Services. It has remained a constant presence on Adweek‚Äôs Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), ranks among Cannes Lions' Top 10 Creative Companies (2022-23) and is the only partner to have been placed in AdExchanger‚Äôs Programmatic Power Players list every year (2020-24). In addition to being named Adweek‚Äôs first AI Agency of the Year (2023), Monks has been recognized by Business Intelligence in its 2024 Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Awards program in three categories: the Individual category, Organizational Winner in AI Strategic Planning and AI Product for its service Monks.Flow. Monks has also garnered the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), won a record number of FWAs and has earned a spot on Newsweek‚Äôs Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023.
¬†
We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents‚Äîand resonates with‚Äîthe world around us.

Job Description: Associate Director of Analytics at .Monks

Position Overview
The Associate Director of Analytics at .Monks will oversee data strategy, measurement frameworks, and performance analysis to drive actionable insights for clients and internal stakeholders. This role requires leadership in developing scalable analytics solutions, guiding teams in advanced data techniques, and ensuring seamless integration of analytics into broader marketing, creative, and business strategies. As a thought leader, the Associate Director will foster innovation in analytics practices while maintaining alignment with client goals.

Key Responsibilities

  • Analytics Strategy & Leadership:

    • Develop and implement comprehensive analytics frameworks aligned with client business objectives.
    • Drive the evolution of data-driven decision-making across digital campaigns and platforms.
    • Collaborate with senior leadership to set measurable KPIs and define success metrics.

  • Data Management & Insights:

    • Oversee data collection, processing, and visualization to ensure accuracy and relevance.
    • Conduct advanced analytics, including attribution modeling, predictive analysis, and ROI measurement.
    • Translate data findings into actionable insights to optimize marketing and creative efforts.

  • Team Collaboration & Mentorship:

    • Lead a team of analysts, ensuring professional development and fostering a collaborative work environment.
    • Partner with cross-functional teams, including creative, strategy, and technology, to integrate analytics into projects.

  • Client Engagement:

    • Serve as a key client-facing expert, presenting insights, reports, and strategic recommendations.
    • Manage client relationships, ensuring analytics solutions exceed expectations and drive measurable impact.

  • Technology & Innovation:

    • Stay informed on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in analytics and martech.
    • Champion the adoption of innovative solutions to enhance analytics capabilities.

Qualifications

  • Proven experience (7+ years) in analytics, data strategy, or a related field, preferably in an agency or consultancy environment.
  • Strong expertise in digital marketing analytics, web analytics (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics), and advanced tools like Tableau or Power BI.
  • Proficiency in statistical analysis, SQL, Python, or R is highly desirable.
  • Demonstrated success in leading teams and managing complex, multi-faceted analytics projects.
  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with a talent for simplifying complex data narratives for diverse audiences.
  • Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Marketing, Data Science, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.

Preferred Skills

  • Familiarity with marketing platforms like Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and programmatic platforms.
  • Experience with experimentation frameworks, such as A/B testing and multivariate testing.
  • Knowledge of data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and their impact on analytics strategies.

Why Join .Monks?
As a part of .Monks, you'll work at the intersection of creativity and data, collaborating with world-class teams to deliver groundbreaking solutions for global brands. This role offers the opportunity to shape the future of analytics in a fast-paced, innovative environment.

#LI-REMOTE

#LI-ZZ1

What We Offer

Benefits

  • Excellent, full coverage medical, dental, and vision insurance with employer-paid HRA
  • Generous PTO and 15 company-wide holidays
  • 401k with company contribution
  • Paid parental leave
  • Work-life balance with an emphasis on personal well-being
  • Career growth in a disruptor space & entrepreneurial opportunities within the Monks network¬†
  • A globally diverse & inclusive culture with employee resource groups such as S4 Melanin, Pride.Monks, Cultura.Monks, and more!
  • Authentic commitment to DEI efforts and sustainable growth. (Why Sir Martin Sorrell signed The Climate Pledge here!)

¬†

¬†

Monks has provided a compensation range that represents its good faith estimate of what Monks may pay for the position at the time of posting. Monks may ultimately pay more or less than the posted compensation range. The salary offered to the selected candidate will be determined based on job-related factors, but not based on a candidate‚Äôs sex or any other protected status.

¬†

Salary Range$120,000‚Äî$170,000 USD

About Monks

Monks is the global, purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc. With a legacy of innovation and specialized expertise, Monks combines an extraordinary range of global marketing and technology services to accelerate business possibilities and redefine how brands and businesses interact with the world. Its integration of systems and workflows delivers unfettered content production, scaled experiences, enterprise-grade technology and data science fueled by AI‚Äîmanaged by the industry‚Äôs best and most diverse digital talent‚Äîto help the world‚Äôs trailblazing companies outmaneuver and outpace their competition.

Monks was named a Contender in The Forrester Wave‚Ñ¢: Global Marketing Services. It has remained a constant presence on Adweek‚Äôs Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), ranks among Cannes Lions' Top 10 Creative Companies (2022-23) and is the only partner to have been placed in AdExchanger‚Äôs Programmatic Power Players list every year (2020-24). In addition to being named Adweek‚Äôs first AI Agency of the Year (2023), Monks has been recognized by Business Intelligence in its 2024 Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Awards program in three categories: the Individual category, Organizational Winner in AI Strategic Planning and AI Product for its service Monks.Flow. Monks has also garnered the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), won a record number of FWAs and has earned a spot on Newsweek‚Äôs Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023.

¬†

We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents‚Äîand resonates with‚Äîthe world around us.¬†
